intro: Spigelia scabra var. angustata, commonly known as narrowleaf spigelia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are tubular and typically pink or red, with five lobes, and are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, elliptical seeds.
